events.name: Prediction of supply vs. demand for metals in LIBs
events.wd_label: Prediction of supply vs. demand for metals in LIBs
events.wd_description: Various literature reports attempt to predict the supply versus demand for metals used in cathode materials for lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) to identify potential future limitations. Modeling and predictions are difficult due to reliance on public information and various influencing factors.
events.description: Various literature reports attempt to predict the supply versus demand for metals used in cathode materials for lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) to identify potential future limitations. Modeling and predictions are difficult due to reliance on public information and various influencing factors.

events.name: Prediction models
events.wd_description: Literature reports use modeling to predict supply and demand for metals in LIBs, considering various scenarios and factors.
events.description: Literature reports use modeling to predict supply and demand for metals in LIBs, considering various scenarios and factors.

events.name: Influencing factors
events.wd_description: Factors influencing supply and demand predictions include time frame, projected number of vehicles, EV technology share, cathode materials used, and weight of each metal per kWh.
events.description: Factors influencing supply and demand predictions include time frame, projected number of vehicles, EV technology share, cathode materials used, and weight of each metal per kWh.

events.name: Public information
events.wd_description: Predictions rely heavily on public information from mining companies and geological surveys, with data on resources and reserves.
events.description: Predictions rely heavily on public information from mining companies and geological surveys, with data on resources and reserves.

events.name: Resource and reserve dynamics
events.wd_description: Resources represent locations with metal presence, while reserves are economically feasible to mine. Feasibility depends on deposit size, metal content, and extraction process. Reserves are dynamic, influenced by socioeconomics, environmental policy, and technology.
events.description: Resources represent locations with metal presence, while reserves are economically feasible to mine. Feasibility depends on deposit size, metal content, and extraction process. Reserves are dynamic, influenced by socioeconomics, environmental policy, and technology.

events.name: Resources
events.wd_description: Resources represent locations where a given metal is present in the Earth's crust.
events.description: Resources represent locations where a given metal is present in the Earth's crust.

events.name: Reserves
events.wd_description: Reserves represent resources that are economically feasible to mine.
events.description: Reserves represent resources that are economically feasible to mine.

events.name: Feasibility factors
events.wd_description: The feasibility of mining reserves depends on deposit size, metal content, and extraction process required.
events.description: The feasibility of mining reserves depends on deposit size, metal content, and extraction process required.

events.name: Estimations and modeling approaches for lithium demand
events.wd_label: Estimations and modeling approaches for lithium demand
events.wd_description: Various approaches are used to estimate lithium demand and supply, considering factors such as EV penetration, recycling rates, and production methods. Different models project different scenarios for future lithium availability.
events.description: Various approaches are used to estimate lithium demand and supply, considering factors such as EV penetration, recycling rates, and production methods. Different models project different scenarios for future lithium availability.

events.name: EV penetration modeling
events.wd_description: Gruber et al. projected lithium demand from 2010 to 2100 based on EV penetration, predicting 100% EV penetration between 2083 and 2087 and estimating significant lithium demand.
events.description: Gruber et al. projected lithium demand from 2010 to 2100 based on EV penetration, predicting 100% EV penetration between 2083 and 2087 and estimating significant lithium demand.

events.name: Recycling impact
events.wd_description: High recycling rates of lithium (90%) could significantly reduce the strain on lithium mining.
events.description: High recycling rates of lithium (90%) could significantly reduce the strain on lithium mining.

events.name: Stochastic modeling
events.wd_description: Calisaya-Azpilcueta et al. used stochastic modeling to combine material flow analysis with sensitivity and uncertainty analysis, projecting a potential undersupply scenario for lithium by 2025.
events.description: Calisaya-Azpilcueta et al. used stochastic modeling to combine material flow analysis with sensitivity and uncertainty analysis, projecting a potential undersupply scenario for lithium by 2025.

events.name: Cobalt supply and demand estimation
events.wd_description: Fu et al. applied scenario models to estimate short-term cobalt supply and demand from 2015 to 2030. The results suggest that cobalt demand for EV LIBs will be high but manageable with projected supply.
events.description: Fu et al. applied scenario models to estimate short-term cobalt supply and demand from 2015 to 2030. The results suggest that cobalt demand for EV LIBs will be high but manageable with projected supply.

events.name: Scenario models
events.wd_description: Fu et al. used scenario models to estimate cobalt supply and demand over a short-term period.
events.description: Fu et al. used scenario models to estimate cobalt supply and demand over a short-term period.

events.name: Short-term demand
events.wd_description: The demand for cobalt in EV LIBs is projected to account for 70% of battery demand by 2030.
events.description: The demand for cobalt in EV LIBs is projected to account for 70% of battery demand by 2030.

events.name: Projected supply
events.wd_description: Projected supply of cobalt is expected to meet short-term demand, with additional contributions from secondary cobalt recovery.
events.description: Projected supply of cobalt is expected to meet short-term demand, with additional contributions from secondary cobalt recovery.
